job_tasks.phrase: Assist researchers and students to efficiently deploy scientific workloads on the various AI/HPC platforms
job_tasks.justification: This phrase indicates the need to understand the scientific research needs (business context) and translate them into actionable deployment strategies on AI/HPC platforms.

job_tasks.phrase: work with researchers to understand and optimize their application (benchmarking, code optimization)
job_tasks.justification: This involves comprehending the researchers' goals and challenges to provide optimized solutions, aligning technical work with user needs.

job_tasks.phrase: Optimizing application workflow (pre-processing, simulation, post-processing, data storage, etc.) to make the best use of a given platform.
job_tasks.justification: This task requires understanding the overall research workflow and business objectives to optimize resource utilization and efficiency.

job_tasks.phrase: Optimizing application workflow (pre-processing, simulation, post-processing, data storage, etc.)
job_tasks.justification: The mention of pre-processing, post-processing, and data storage within application workflows directly relates to data engineering tasks.
The job title itself implies support and interaction with AI/ML applications, which inherently involves understanding and potentially optimizing models.
Benchmarking and code optimization are activities often performed to improve the performance of underlying ML models or scientific simulations.

job_tasks.phrase: deploy scientific workloads on the various AI/HPC platforms, such as batch computing clusters (local clusters, SURF CPU/GPU clusters) and cloud infrastructure (like Azure and Rescale)
job_tasks.justification: Deploying workloads on specific platforms involves software deployment and integration tasks.
Optimizing workflows often involves scripting, configuring, and integrating different software components.
Possessing infrastructure engineering know-how, even with a focus on applications, suggests involvement in operational aspects of AI/HPC systems.
Benchmarking and administration of workloads are key operational tasks in managing computing resources.
Training end-users on how to use AI/HPC platforms and workflows falls under operational support and enablement.

soft_skills.phrase: help us build and professionalize this innovative service.
rise above yourself, in your profession, and as a person? Do you want to be challenged every day?
You will closely work with researchers, students of all departments, and TU/e institutes as well as with industry partners.
help us shape the future of our university, scientists, and students.

classification.rationale: While the role involves AI/ML, the primary focus is on application support, workflow optimization, and infrastructure interaction (HPC, cloud). It lacks the core focus on algorithm development, model training/evaluation, or productionizing prototypes from data scientists typical of an ML Engineer. The role is more application-centric and operational, leaning away from pure ML model building.
